greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 2^(n-1) mod n.
comment: If p is an odd prime then a(p)=1. However, a(n) is also 1 for pseudoprimes to base 2 such as 341.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..101101 (first 1000 terms from Harry J. Smith)
Index entries for sequences related to pseudoprimes
program: (PARI) A062173(n) = if(1==n, 0, lift(Mod(2, n)^(n-1))); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 01 2018
a062173 n = powerMod 2 (n - 1) n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 17 2015
xref: Cf. A176997 (after the initial term, gives the positions of ones).
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jun 12 2001
